item.title: Report E-2024120127
item.description:
Report E-2024120127

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-10T12:24:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-05
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 5, 2024, three (3) half-gallon (0.5) containers of UN3266 were crushed and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety & Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the site. The crew utilized neutralizing agent and absorbent pads to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120070
item.description:
Report E-2024120070

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-09T12:25:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-03
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 3, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon pail of paint was damaged in transit and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024120429
item.description:
Report X-2024120429

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-09T12:25:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-27
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Outer packaging: brown fiberboard box. Inner contents: (Printing Ink, PGII)1 metal can @1 Liter (leaked) product information is covered in white paint (R3843-183G13 White, 918441, CKSH03, CRGFS1719288). 1 plastic bottle, approx. 3-4 Liters, Printing Ink, PGII, (No Release) Product info: NLLFSOO31242. The shipper provided the SDS. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2024110460
item.description:
Report E-2024110460

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-09T12:25:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-09
  • City: GEORGETOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4560
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank when the connection between the hose adaptor and tank became compromised. This allowed approximately 15 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. Lone Star Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
